channel.title: Dfir on Ctrl+Alt+Dark
channel.description: Recent content in Dfir on Ctrl+Alt+Dark

item.title: Speed vs Depth: The Art of Investigation Theory in the Real World
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Learn to balance speed and thoroughness in MDR investigations using Kill Chain analysis and Likelihood vs Impact matrices to make fast, defensible decisions under pressure.

item.title: MSSQL Cheat Sheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Microsoft SQL Server forensics and threat hunting guide covering registry paths, log locations, attack indicators, and configuration analysis for compromised SQL Server instances.

item.title: Windows Registry Cheat Sheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Key Windows Registry locations for persistence mechanisms, user activity traces, and IOC hunting in malware analysis and forensic investigations for DFIR professionals.

item.title: Windows Log Analysis Cheat Sheet (+ Chainsaw)
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Critical Windows event IDs, logon types, and log locations for threat hunting and incident response, including Security.evtx, PowerShell logs, and Chainsaw analysis techniques.

item.title: Huntress - Weaponized Velociraptor Delivers Ransomware
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Investigation uncovered three distinct incidents where threat actors weaponized Velociraptor, a legitimate DFIR tool, for persistent command-and-control access. Attackers exploited SharePoint and WSUS vulnerabilities, installed Velociraptor as a Windows service communicating through Cloudflare tunnels, and deployed secondary tools including VS Code, OpenSSH, and TightVNC. One incident linked to Storm-2603 resulted in Warlock ransomware deployment.
